title: 'Genius' Mo Salah goal earns Liverpool much-needed win over Manchester City
description: Much of the pre-match talk ahead of Liverpool's English Premier League clash against Manchester City had been about City's goal machine Erling Haaland, and rightly so given the striker's record-breaking form.

title: Real Madrid defeats Barcelona in El Clásico to go top of La Liga
description: Real Madrid and Barcelona both took to the field unbeaten in La Liga this season, with Barça leading its rival on points difference at the top of the league.

title: Russian attacks killed 10 civilians in Ukraine in past 24 hours, Ukrainian official says
More than 1,000 teddy bears left in Queen Elizabeth tribute will be donated to children's charity
description: More than 1,000 teddy bears left in tribute to Queen Elizabeth II will be donated to a children's charity, Buckingham Palace announced.

title: This meat has unreal tenderness from being wrapped in clay, Stone Age style
description: Get ready to get your hands dirty and eat heartily. An Italian chef in southern Italy is resurrecting an ancient cooking method that makes the most tender, fall-apart lamb.

title: Climate change exposes lack of US preparedness in defending Arctic Ocean interests, US senator says
description: Climate change is unlocking a new crossroads and potential center of conflict: the Arctic. But one key lawmaker is warning the US has lagged behind in securing the region, as other powers move in, adding he believes the Arctic may soon be a stage for a nuclear show of force by Vladimir Putin.

title: Biden will wait for Congress to return before taking any major steps on US-Saudi relationship, national security adviser says
description: President Joe Biden's reassessment of the United States' relationship with Saudi Arabia will happen "methodically" and will include bipartisan consultations, and there will be no major changes until after Congress returns from recess, according to national security adviser Jake Sullivan.

title: Othered: How racism became institutional in the UK
Cub cam offers a unique glimpse into the early days of a vulnerable species
description: Nestled in their heated den, the newborn cheetah cubs at Smithsonian's Conservation Biology Institute spend their days doing what just about any young animal does — a lot of sleeping. What makes these cubs special, however, is their dedicated online audience, checking in from all over the world to monitor the growing babies and experience their developmental milestones.

title: How the filmmakers behind 'Till' depicted Black trauma without showing violence
description: Chinonye Chukwu didn't want to make a movie about Black trauma.

title: Was this the biggest upset in postseason history? Padres stun Dodgers to reach National League Championship Series
description: Was this the biggest upset in postseason history? The Los Angeles Dodgers were on a winning streak like no other -- but it is the San Diego Padres who are on their way to the National League Championship Series (NLCS).

title: NATO and Russia to hold long planned exercises of nuclear forces
The spookiest cities in the US -- and why they still scare us
description: Several locales across the US claim to be king when it comes to Halloween. But three in particular -- Savannah, Georgia; New Orleans and Salem, Massachusetts -- have the haunting histories to truly earn the title.

title: Trump's all-caps rage is back. Has America changed?
description: Poetry's genius is that it offers both an endless supply of words and a fresh way of looking at everything under the sun. As an example, the word "majusculation" -- from the noun "majuscule," meaning upper case or capital lettering (the inverse of "miniscule") -- in poetry refers to the capitalization of the first letter in every line of a poem.

title: Nikolas Cruz has avoided the death penalty. Here's what's next for him now
description: Here's what we know: Nikolas Cruz, the now 24-year-old who admitted to killing 17 people in Florida's Marjory Stoneman Douglas High School in February 2018, has avoided the death penalty.

title: Claressa Shields beats Savannah Marshall in historic fight to unify world titles
description: Claressa Shields became the undisputed world middleweight champion, defeating her bitter rival Savannah Marshall by unanimous decision at the O2 Arena in London.

title: Tesla investors try to look past Elon Musk's many, many distractions
description: Elon Musk now wants to buy Twitter after all. While that's good news for Twitter's long-suffering shareholders, Tesla investors hope he still has some time for them. They need a little help, too.

title: Sheffield United 3-3 Blackpool: Match descends into chaos, ending with four red cards and a mass brawl
description: Where to start in a match such as this? The 98th-minute equalizer, or the four red cards? The missed penalty or perhaps the mass brawl?

title: This plant was thought to be extinct until it was rediscovered in a crater on Hawaii
description: A rare plant thought to be extinct in the wild has been discovered in a crater on Hawaii.

title: Gunmen kill 11, wound 15 in attack on Russian military recruits
description: Two gunmen opened fire on Russian military recruits at a training ground in Russia's Belgorod region, killing at least 11 people and wounding another 15, Russia's state news agency TASS reports.

title: 12-meter floods to inundate thousands of properties, Australian emergency services warn
description: Australian Prime Minister Anthony Albanese toured flooded areas of the southeastern state of Victoria Sunday -- as emergency services warned waters up to 12 meters were expected to inundate thousands of properties.

title: Billions of snow crabs have disappeared from the waters around Alaska. Scientists say overfishing is not the cause
description: The Alaska snow crab harvest has been canceled for the first time ever after billions of the crustaceans have disappeared from the cold, treacherous waters of the Bering Sea in recent years.

title: 'People died in families.' Survivors from liberated Izium tell of devastating airstrike
description:
• Gunmen kill at least 11 in attack on Russian military recruits: Russian state media
• Iran denies supplying Russia with weapons for use in Ukraine
• Video: Ukrainians show video of drone strikes on Russian targets

title: Gunmen kill 12 people in Mexico bar
description: Mexican authorities are searching for gunmen who killed at least 12 people and injured three more after opening fire in a bar in central Mexico on Saturday evening.

title: The arrest of a suspect in a series of deadly shootings in California 'stopped another killing,' police say
description: With the California city of Stockton on edge following a series of late-night shootings by an unknown assailant, police officials believe another killing was prevented with the arrest of a suspect this weekend.

title: Netflix's 'The Midnight Club' breaks the record for most jump scares in one episode
description: Jump scare haters, beware of Netflix's new series "The Midnight Club."

title: Here's why Xi's subtle gesture during speech worries people
description: During Xi Jinping's almost two-hour speech at the opening ceremony of the Communist Party Congress, the Chinese leader paused several times to clear his throat and sip tea. CNN's Beijing Bureau Chief Steven Jiang explains why the subtle gestures have some online observers concerned.

title: World faces full-blown recession if China economy collapses: Expert
description: China's economy is in terrible shape. Unemployment is skyrocketing, the housing market is collapsing, and growth is stalling. Constant covid lockdowns are dragging on virtually every part of the country's economy. Swathes of the population are struggling to make ends meet. CNN's Selina Wang speaks to people who aren't seeing the economic benefits Xi has pledged under his rule.

title: Iran security official confirms fire at notorious Evin prison
All eyes are on leader Xi Jinping, who is expected to take on an unprecedented third term, paving the way for potential lifelong rule
China kicks off 20th Communist Party Congress as Xi Jinping prepares to expand power
From Mao to Xi: A history of China's leadership
description: CNN's Ivan Watson takes a historical look back at Chinese leaders from Mao Zeping to Xi Jinping, and how they shaped modern China.

title: The expected coronation for China's supreme leader Xi has begun
description: • Analysis: Xi poised to become China's most powerful leader since Mao Zedong

title: Russian author blasts Putin for 'ruining' peace with Ukraine
description: Russian author Dmitry Glukhovsky tells CNN's Pamela Brown why he chose to speak out against Russia's invasion of Ukraine, and some of the consequences he faces.

title: Biden says January 6 committee has made an 'overwhelming' case
description: President Joe Biden said on Saturday the video and testimony shared at the January 6 hearing this week was "devastating" and said the committee overall has made an "overwhelming" case.

title: Anger at China's zero-Covid policy is rising, but Beijing refuses to change course
Xi's expected coronation begins as China's Communist Party convenes congress to extend leader's rule
Russia's new general has a reputation for brutality
